questions.question_text: Which two technologies optimize MPLS infrastructure using bandwidth protection services when experiencing slow response? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
A & C are correct

Selected Answer: AC
A i C are the correct answers

choices.A: The last P router in the path pops off the transport label before traffic is forwarded toward the PE.
choices.D: The second to last P router in the path pops off the VPN label before traffic is forwarded to the last P router.
choices.B: The VPN label is popped off at the egress LSR, and unlabeled traffic is forwarded toward the CE.
choices.C: The transport label is popped off at the egress LSR, and unlabeled traffic is forwarded toward the CE.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
In Penultimate Hop Popping (PHP), the penultimate router (the second-to-last router in the path) removes (or "pops off") the MPLS transport label, not the last router (which is the egress LSR).
The last P router (egress LSR) simply forwards the unlabeled packet to the Customer Edge (CE) router, without performing any label operations.

Selected Answer: A
A is corerct
A is correct. This way the PE receives a packet without the LDP label, and doesn't have to do an extra lookup in the LFIB before forwarding the packet to a non-MPLS router like CE.

Selected Answer: A
its A: PHP can be performed in frame-based MPLS networks. In these networks, the last P router in the LSP tunnel pops the LDP label as previously requested by the egress PE router through LDP. So, the PE router receives a labeled packet that contains only the VPN label.

questions.question_text: What is the function of penultimate hop popping?

//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. Spoke routers do not learn about each other's routes in the DMVPN Phase2 network. Which action resolves the issue?

choices.C: Configure a static route in each spoke to establish a spoke-to-spoke tunnel.
choices.D: Remove default route from spoke routers to establish a spoke-to-spoke tunnel.
choices.B: Rectify incorrect wildcard mask configured on the hub router network command.
choices.A: Disable EIGRP split horizon on the Tunnel0 interface of the hub router.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is corerct

Selected Answer: A
Agree on A considering the few information we have from the topology provided and considering that EIGRP is the protocol used internally

Selected Answer: A
A is corerct

Selected Answer: A
As soon as you see the highest priority and considering the requirements, confirmed...Its A

Selected Answer: A
A is correct:
https://study-ccna.com/designated-backup-designated-router/
1. router with the highest OSPF priority will become a DR. By default, all routers have a priority of 1.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. The security department recently installed a monitoring device between routers R3 and R5, which caused a loss of network connectivity for users connected to R5. Troubleshooting revealed that the monitoring device cannot forward multicast packets. The team already updated R5 with the correct configuration. Which configuration must be implemented on R3 to resolve the problem by ensuring R3 as the DR for the R3-R5 segment?

choices.B:
interface FastEthernet0/0
ip address 10.99.53.1 255.255.255.252
ip access-group 122 in
ip ospf network non-broadcast
ip ospf priority 0
!
router ospf 10
router-id 10.10.3.255
neighbor 10.99.53.2
!
access-list 122 permit 88 host 10.99.53.2 host 10.99.53.1
access-list 122 deny 88 any any
access-list 122 permit tcp any any
access-list 122 permit udp any any
access-list 122 permit icmp any any
choices.A:

!

network 10.99.53.0 0.0.0.3 area 0
neighbor 10.99.53.2
!
access-list 122 permit 89 host 10.99.53.2 host 10.99.53.1

access-list 122 permit udp any any
access-list 122 permit icmp any any

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Traditional MPLS LDP - Hop by Hop forwarding. No tunnels involved

MPLS LDP TE (Traffic Engineering) involves tunnels unidirectional
MPLS Traffic Engineering (TE), where explicit, unidirectional tunnels are set up for traffic flow optimization, resource reservation, or meeting specific SLA requirements.

Selected Answer: D
D is correct

Selected Answer: D
D is correct!
